Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, the user wants an event log for process mining. It should have columns: Case ID (using order_id), Activity Name, Timestamp, and optionally Resource/Actor and other attributes.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: My main tasks are: 1. Identify Cases: Use order_id as the Case ID. 2. Derive Activities: From the tables, create events like: Order Created from Orders table. Items Picked from Order Lines table. Order Dispatched and Order Arrived from Delivery table. Invoice Issued from Invoice table. Payment Received from Payments table.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: For Items Picked: From Order Lines table, timestamp is the picking date. Since there are multiple per order, Ill create one event per order with the earliest item_picking_date, and resource as the picker_id (maybe the most common one, or just pick one).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, lets list out the possible events for each order: Order Created: From Orders table, timestamp is order_date, resource is sales_person_id. Items Picked: From Order Lines table... Order Dispatched: From Delivery table... etc.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Assumptions: For Items Picked, Ill use the earliest item_picking_date for the order as the timestamp, and the corresponding picker_id. For orders with multiple deliveries, like order 1002 has two, I might need multiple events... For multiple invoices, separate events.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Structure the table: Columns: Case ID, Activity Name, Timestamp, Resource/Actor, and maybe other attributes. Other Attributes could include things like delivery_note, invoice_amount, etc., but Ill add them if relevant. Now, build the table. First, collect all events: For each order, create a list of events with their details, then sort by timestamp, and compile into one table.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me sketch for order 1001: 1. Activity: Order Created, Timestamp: 2024-01-01T09:00:00Z, Resource: Alice Brown (from SP-001) 2. Activity: Items Picked... and so on for others.
